meanings.definition: An examination or review of financial records before an official audit.
meanings.sent1: The preaudit helped identify any potential issues before the official audit.
meanings.sent2: The company always conducts a preaudit to ensure accuracy in their financial records.
meanings.sent3: During the preaudit, the accountant found a small mistake and fixed it right away.
meanings.sent4: The preaudit acted as a magnifying glass, revealing hidden errors in the financial records.
meanings.sent5: The preaudit was like a detective, searching for clues in the numbers.

meanings.definition: To conduct a preliminary examination of financial records before an official audit.
meanings.sent1: The accountant will preaudit the financial records to prepare for the official audit.
meanings.sent2: It is important to preaudit the documents to catch any errors early on.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to preaudit the records on Friday, just to be safe.
meanings.sent4: She preaudited the accounts meticulously, leaving no stone unturned.
meanings.sent5: Before the audit, they always preaudit to ensure everything is in order.
